ygData.subject: Re: How can I create a complete graph in Heritrix?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello everyone again. I m sorry to bother but I m out of ways. I read a lot of things about WARC in the group and there was a topic that has just what I want

Hello everyone again.

I'm sorry to bother but I'm out of ways. I read a lo=
t of things about WARC in the group and there was a topic that has just wha=
t I want but it didn't get how to do it. The topic is (http://tech.groups.y=
ahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/4099) but I don't know how to handle=
 with them. So, my problems are:

=3D> 1: How can I handle with WARCFiles? =
What's the pattern? Where can I have more information about it? 

=3D> 2: I=
 perceive that ARCFiles, like below, has a pattern but I have to be sure ab=
out it. Is WARC-Target-URI the URI downloaded? I notice that http://www.cfp=
n.mar.mil.br/ has more links that we have in outlink. Is that correct or th=
e others outlinks could be in others parts of the ARCFile?

WARC/1.0
WARC-T=
ype: metadata

02-28T18:15:47Z

1e5ab6c>

il.br/cfpn/ L a/@href


Thanks again to everything.

Elverton.

--- In=
 archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Elverton" <uelverton@...> wrote:
>
> Hi =
Travis,
> 
> Thanks for the answer. I'll make this after the "re-crawling" =
because I disabled the WARCWriteProcessor in the first crawl. 
> I'll retur=
n the results to this post when I finish the graph.
> 
> Thanks again. :)
>=
 
> Att.
> Elverton.
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, travis@ w=
rote:
> >
> > Elverton,
> > 
> > Have you looked at the metadata in the war=
cs? Each record should list
> > extracted links regardless of whether they =
were crawled due to scoping rules.
> > Extract this set and intersect it wi=
th actual crawled uris to obtain a full
> > graph within what was crawled. =
You may also consider that the extractor also
> > has a [high] limit on the=
 number of URIs it extracts.
> > 
> > Travis
> > 
> > On Mon, February 27, =
2012 11:45 am, Elverton wrote:
> > > Hello everybody,
> > >
> > > As I sent=
 a email to Gordon this afternoon (below), I want to record and get
> > > s=
uggestion how can I get more information about a URI before it get 'uniqued=
'.
> > > As I read at "Mohr-et-al-2004', the way to decide what to do with =
a URI is at
> > > Prefetch, more exactly in Preselector. But I don't have a=
 clue what filter or
> > > rule can help me. Any suggestions?
> > >
> > > A=
tt.
> > > Elverton.
> > >
> > > =3D> The original message:
> > > ----------=
-----------------------------------------------------
> > >  Hello Gordon,
=
> > >
> > >  My name is Elverton. I'm doing a research in a metric to estim=
ate the numbers
> > > of URL of a domain. I have a problem to solve and you=
 think you can help me.
> > >
> > >  I want to make a complete graph of all=
 URL's collected but all I have from
> > > crawl.log is the "father" of the=
 URL and the URL. This would be necessary but
> > > I have an misundertandi=
ng about one thing: If heritrix collect one URL,
> > > suppose "yahoo.com" =
from "google.com". If the heritrix enter in "amazon.com"
> > > and found "y=
ahoo.com" again, in crawl.log will appear:
> > >
> > >  - - - yahoo.com - g=
oogle.com
> > >  - - - yahoo.com - amazon.com
> > >
> > >  or only:
> > >
>=
 > >  - - - yahoo.com - google.com
> > >
> > >  So, the heritrix will ignor=
e the found in "amazon.com" because it was already
> > > found in "google.c=
om"?
> > >
> > >  Att.
> > >  Elverton.
> > >
> > > -----------------------=
----------------------------------------
> > >
> > > =3D> Gordon's answer:
=
> > >
> > > ---------------------------------------------------------------=

> > >
> > > You're correct, the crawl.log is not enough info to make a ful=
l web
> > > graph... it only records the exact paths that led to a URI bein=
g first
> > > discovered. You'd need to log more from the crawler before it=
 'uniques'
> > > the URIs for crawling purposes, or perform a post-crawl an=
alysis on the
> > > full link-containing content, to create the web graph.
=
> > >
> > > - Gordon
> > >
> > > ------------------------------------------=
---------------------
> > >
